result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L Schwalbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:35 Defendant Samantha L Schwalbach in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Samantha L Schwalbach in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Goldberg is sworn as witness and testifies to being an officer with the Wood County Sheriffs department.  Testifies to the being called to a residence on March 6, 2015.  The witness identifies the defendant as being one of the people at the residence involved in the disturbance.  Testifies to what was said by a child at the residence involving the defendant.  Testifies to the childs age and what the child told the officer that interviewed him about what happened.  State give their arguments for probable cause.  Atty. Slattery argues against probable cause and asks for case to be dismissed.  Bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Samantha L Schwalbach in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Comply with Human Services & absolute sobriety.
Absolute sobriety. Comply with placement through DHS.
